website_summaries.verdict: This desk's generous size has enough space for a mouse, if you're so inclined. Fits laptops up to 17 inches.
pros: Angled desk of wider-than-normal size allows mouse use
Height easily adjusts from 9.4 to 12.6 inches
cons: Mouse could slide off when desk is tilted

customer_reviews.title: but the arthritis in her fingers makes it very painful to hold the book
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves to read in bed, but the arthritis in her fingers makes it very painful to hold the book. I researches the market carefully - finding devices that ran from $90 to $3000! She sis delighted with it, and has already found other configurations to use it in. It works great on her recliner, the bed, etc. She is happy, I am happy! Bill the librarian (married 57 years)
customer_reviews.author: Bill The Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight little table.
customer_reviews.text: I use it mainly to eat and watch TV on the floor. I can still put my legs under the table even on the lowest height setting. I also use it for my 15" laptop. If you want to use a mouse, it'll fit but you'll have about 5" to move it around. The table wobbles a little bit but not where it's bad. Works great on the bed also. Overall, I'm happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ZoNgMaN

customer_reviews.title: only last 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product last year in October and both legs were cracked about last month and finally last night it totally fell apart. When I was purchased it last time it was 45$ and it only last 7 months, and now they raised the price to 76$ which is outrageous and frankly, disgusting. They are trying to take advantage of current situation as more people working from home and need this type of product.
customer_reviews.author: Hoorvash Kamal

customer_reviews.title: Was great! Until it broke
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product. It has a good range of angles and was easy to set up and move around. HOWEVER one of the legs broke just a couple months after purchase. I’m sad it appears to be a cheaply made product b/c I was really liking it. Obviously would not recommend as I’d like my products to last more than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Darned near perfect for my use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a wheelchair bound disabled veteran. After using lap boards for years, I was looking for something that wouldn't leave scratches and bruises on my legs. This laptop table fits the bill perfectly. I was able to adjust it to the perfect height and angle for me to use comfortably while seated in my chair. The only things I would add to it would be a fan to help cool my laptop computer and maybe an add-on tray to store small items such as earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Michael PaleRider

customer_reviews.title: No thank you
customer_reviews.text: Returned this immediately. Description said it was white, but it was a white washed fake wood look. Ugly AF. Might of replaced it with the “black” one, but was afraid it was going to look like black cheap wood look. Looks like a cheap laminate fake wood sticker.
customer_reviews.author: Brad with a B

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is really overpriced for what you get. The grey tabs that keep things in place keep falling out and upon arrival the faux wood grain had a strange kind of mark across the whole thing. I thought it was maybe just dust from the factory, but nope it seems to be a defect. In general this thing is probably only worth about $10-15. I wouldn't buy it again given the price. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Sawyer Yates

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent bed tray table/laptop desk
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent bed tray table/laptop desk. It works like a height adjustable portable folding table, which is exactly what I wanted, a portable desk that adjusts to varying heights depending upon where I am sitting or standing. The fact that you can also tilt the top is a great feature. I also love that the legs, when folded, stay folded in place so you can transport this table without pinching your fingers or whacking yourself accidentally. Great purchase, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Bird

customer_reviews.title: worked great until it broke
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was extremely pleased with this product. The wider size was perfect for use with a 17" laptop and a mouse. Unfortunately until it broke 2 months after use. The cheap fiber board simply didn't hold the screws in very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, but not entirely sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use this on the couch and the bed to keep my laptop elevated and to eat while watching television. I like how it adjusts in height and also in angle (tilts), because this is better for your neck, shoulders, and back. It’s important to hAve that direct eye contact with the screen without unnaturally raising your arms. It’s comfortable to use, has enough leg room, and holds up my items. The flaw is that using the locks doesn’t always make it sturdy. For example, the legs might fold in or easily and accidentally be adjusted higher or lower. It still works; I just have to be a little careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect laptop table!
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop table! The adjustable legs are sturdy and do not buckle with the laptop weight and pressure from your arms at all. I have a 17" laptop, and I still have plenty of room to use a mouse alongside my laptop. I work long hours at the office and at home, and this table has given me the comfort I have craved to work from the couch or coffee table whilst playing my favorite shows in the background. It's a welcome change from sitting at a dark desk all night long. I highly recommend this product for work, or even just for the comfort of using your laptop for browsing at your leisure anywhere you wish.
customer_reviews.author: Meeshell

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I don't often write reviews anymore but felt I had to for this product. I purchased this tray after having surgery and needing to use my computer for hours each day in bed. I chose the XL version solely because all the other trays I'd tried before were too narrow and made me sit uncomfortably. Not this one! I am a male 6'4' 230lbs and I was able to sit comfortably with the tray over my lap. The height range offered is great, and the ability to quickly and easily adjust the angle has been a life-saver to my neck. If you're looking for a great laptop tray, you've found the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I have made during COVID lockdown!
customer_reviews.text: I am using the table as I write this. This product is sturdy, easily adjustable, and VERY comfortable to use. It fits my devices from my Surface Pro to my 17 inch laptop with no problem. I am currently working from home, and this item has been a lifesaver both convenience and comfort wise. I have also used it to write in ledgers, for reading (both Kindle and book), as well as enjoying lunch on it. The table folds away very quickly for storage, and sets up in no time when it is needed again. I would recommend this item highly.
customer_reviews.author: Tina M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable workstation!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this portable workstation after trying several others only to be disappointed re sturdiness, quality and durability. After having back surgery, I had to work from a standing position. For work and trainings, I needed a workstation that was light weight, easy to transport and provided sturdiness to be able to conduct work using my laptop. This laptop tray table is a winner in all areas. It has adjustable heights to allow me to use a table, desk, counter, etc. to work from while standing. Excellent product and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.author: Jean H.

customer_reviews.title: Great lap desk!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could work from home in bed while recovering from surgery. I think it's totally great except for one thing – the tall bumper that is on the left side is too tall, at least with my Mac. I'm not able to type with it on, but thankfully I'm able to remove it. I wish it was like the smaller bumper on the right side. I ended up moving the soft bumper to the left so that I can use a mouse still. Left handers would need to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney O

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for me. I have a 17 inch Alienware gaming laptop and it fits perfectly! I have plenty of room for my mouse pad and mouse. I have to be very careful as my laptop is very heavy and will tip the table easily. But I’m able to sit on my couch or lay on it and play with this table. I can change the angle and hight while using it and that is handy when I change positions. It’s not real sturdy, no clue how long it will last, so I’m carful with it. It also is great for holding my ipad when I’m watching a movie on it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise L.

customer_reviews.title: Life saving in quarantine
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to give our family flexibility. Shortly after receiving it I started a new job where I am working remotely. Had I not already had this desk on hand I do not know what I would have done without it. It give me plenty of room and the ability to work from bed sitting or standing. I am only 5’2” so standing may not work for everyone. My only complaint is that while it is easy to adjust on its on, it is difficult to adjust when you have things on it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Students Who Like to Sit on the Bed or Sofa to Study
customer_reviews.text: I am a Pre-Med College Student and studying on a desk for several hours at a time can be exhausting. I purchased this so I can relax on my bed or sofa without having to constantly adjust myself in ten different directions. Easy to set up and comfortable enough to put a Macbook Pro 16" and iPad Pro 11" to take notes on it simultaneously. Big and Spacious!! I definitely recommend this to anyone looking to relax and do productive work. Aesthetically, it is modern and smooth. Love the faux wood finish! I bought it in the dark gray/black wood color.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and super easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I think I've finally found the perfect laptop table! I ordered the large size which is great if you use a mouse or need a small space to one side for notes and such. It's lightweight and folds up really flat to store. The height and angle are super easy to adjust within seconds. It's great quality and very stable even while using it in bed. It doesn't wobble or fold up on me while using it. The bumpers hold my laptop and mouse in place so they don't slide into my lap or onto the floor. I'm so happy I found this as I was incredibly frustrated with my other laptop table. Absolutely thrilled with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MississippiMomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of leg room & keeps laptop at eye level
customer_reviews.text: Due to recent neck pain, I was looking for a lap desk that elevated my laptop to eye level. I found it. Pros: Adjusts easily up to 12" high. Plenty of leg room - especially for plus size people. With the flip of 2 levers, you can quickly tilt desk to a comfortable angle for wrists & typing. Fits great on a recliner or bed. Large size works perfect for 17" laptop. Con: The silicone wrist pad & the computer / book holder tend to fall off when you stand desk up or flip over to fold up. However this is mild. SOLUTION: use glue dots or other adhesive to keep them in place. 😊 I do recommend this desk.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, keep up the quality!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a desk because it can’t fit in my room and to say the least, this item has been a miracle! I am using a 15 inch laptop on the larger black table with a mouse on the side and it has enough room to maneuver around. It sits on my bed perfectly fine and stable, the height adjustment works very well and easily, and the length between both of the legs give me plenty of room to move around. I’d recommend this product to anyone wanting to multi task in the comfort of their own bed or just to stream videos, movies, or gaming! Very pleased with my product.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Aaron Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you take care of it
customer_reviews.text: Construction - Don't fold and unfold the legs too often because the plastic locking mechanism will wear out. Legs are sturdy enough to support 7 pounds without wobble. Desk is spacious enough for a 15 inch notebook and mouse but nothing more. Ergonomics - Depending on your body type, the height range fits most people, but I would have preferred the lowest leg height to go 1-2 inches lower. Typing on a couch with the desk configured to the lowest height, my arms are angled slightly above the horizon (around 15 degrees). Cosmetics - A few specs of white paint on the working surface. Overall, a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Dp

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After only 4 months of use the rubber edging is separating from the table. Crumbs of the adhesive used fall in my lap and on the sofa. When I requested an additional part (the soft rubber heel rest) I received a reply that made no sense. I dropped the request. I am not happy with the short term of use. The only good thing for me is that by raising the laptop I have done away with neck and should pain. I am now looking for a more serviceable replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Ernst

customer_reviews.title: average sized and this is perfect. I have table adjusted on an angle while ...
customer_reviews.text: I was only interested in something I could use in bed, late night binge watching on Prime, surfing the web...I am writing this review in bed on Sunday early afternoon as I wanted to be sure the item does what I need. Plenty of clearance between my legs and over my legs as I lay prone in bed. I am 5'11" 185#...average sized and this is perfect. I have table adjusted on an angle while typing this and it is very comfortable while typing and secure on my bed. This fills the bill for what I wanted and item appears to be very well built...I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great bed tray table!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this table for a 12" tablet I recently purchased. I was using a snack table next to my bed. This table makes it more comfortable and easier for me to use my tablet! I also like the features where the tray and legs are adjustable. The table was at the perfect height, so I didn't need to adjust it. It's also the perfect size, not too big and not too small! I highly recommend buying it! You won't be disappointed! Patricia from Charlotte,NC
customer_reviews.author: P. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, and it's perfect for what I need. Other stands like this don't give you the ability to adjust the lower placement holders to your liking. This one lets you configure those placement holders however you want, and in the pic you can see for me, I like my laptop right in the center of the surface, so I moved the laptop placement holder right in the center, and I'm not using the second placement holder. Great for working in bed, the adjustable tilt angles are a MUST for proper ergonomics when typing in bed. No strain on the neck or eyes when angling the laptop in a downward sloped position.
customer_reviews.author: Ronen

customer_reviews.title: STURDY, ADJUSTABLE AND FOLDS UP
customer_reviews.text: We love this tray! It works perfect. My husband likes to eat on the sofa while watching sports. The tray fits perfect over him, very sturdy. It is also adjustable for height. It is very easy to use. It folds up compact slim. Can have handy in between sofa and end table. Also great for sitting in bed or sofa and addressing envelopes and cards. Also, great for reading a hardback novel, the tray tilts and has a rest for book so does not slide off. Also great for putting your laptop on it. It has multiple uses. Easy to travel with it. It really is an AWESOME table tray. I really like that it folds up. Nice looking also.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect work surface
customer_reviews.text: I have neck pain from hunching over while crocheting. I needed something that would sit high up, hold my project and maybe provide somewhere to rest my wrists. This is just what I hoped for. I'm small so it sits higher on me even w/o extending the legs. The surface is large enough for me to rest my forearms on and hold my project. It's also sturdy enough to hold my clip on light. Its lightweight and sturdy so I'm comfortable toting it around. Worth every penny. Note: This is not designed for what I use it for so there is no padding for the wrist or forearm and mine get sore after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight, compact,  and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This lapdesk is good quality, lightweight, portable, sturdy, and versatile. It is a great accessory for drawing reading, and supporting devices. It can be used as a flat table or angled to suit the needs of specific activities, such as drawing or writing. I love how lightweight and portable it is. It folds flat for storage and portability. I would have liked having one more position available - a more upright position for holding materials for display purposes. With that, this versatile tray table would get 5+ stars!
customer_reviews.author: Oregana

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Large
customer_reviews.text: I had been debating for a long time on what type of portable desk I wanted. I'm happy that I bought this one. It was the right decision for me instead of a lap desk. This one is multi-functional and easy to use! Just open the box, make your height adjustments and angle it if you want. The large works great for me because I can place my entire text book on the desk and a 2 subject spiral. I highly recommend this desk.
customer_reviews.author: Belle F

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy but needs more adjustment options
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and more then enough room for a laptop and mouse. Wish the top/legs could be set to any degree angle. When adjusting the joint that connects the legs and top have groves at predefined degrees. Also, when the top is set to any angle over 0° (Tilted toward the user) the mouse constantly slides to the bottom by the wrist wrest. I would recommend having gripper material where the mouse would be so it didn't slide. Ultimately I returned it because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Strangely enough the box that it came in wasn't damaged, which leads me to believe that it was sent that way. when i tried to unlatch the right foot, it just came off. I am astounded at the quality for product that cost almost 40$. i am just not sure what to do? do i send it back? i can't use it like this. Very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Apoc

customer_reviews.title: nice table
customer_reviews.text: I had a wooden bed table that broke and wanted something sturdier. This is a little on the small side, but I like the fact it's not wood and feels sturdy. The legs don't "lock" in place at the level, so when you pick it up, they slide to the longer setting. But overall a nice table, think I'll have this one for quite some time. I haven't used the tilt feature, but it's easy to use. UPDATE: THIS IS NOT GOOD FOR USING IN BED..TIPS OVER VERY EASILY.....
customer_reviews.author: Judy Bonghi

customer_reviews.title: Useful but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am 5,3 and 125 lb and it provides enough room for my legs. The hight is fine if you sit on a sturdy surface like the floor but could be a bit high on a soft surface. Depending on how leveled your soft surface is it might lean left of right. Enough space for a 15 in laptop and a little notepad. Overall nice as a diversifier for your working routine. Might be hard for everyday use. The folding is not the smoothest so not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Graduate

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, but flawed design...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice larger size laptop stand. It seems made very well, easily adjustable, and fits a really large laptop (like my 17"+ gaming laptop). However, it really needs to be able to have lower adjustment on the legs (it's simply too tall) because even at the minimum height it puts the keyboard uncomfortably high. Also, the laptop and mouse "lip" is too tall and gets in the way of using the keyboard and mouse. Thankfully, they're removable, but it leaves four holes in the top of your tray. I waited too long to send it back or I would have.
customer_reviews.author: C. PilotTop Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and high quality.
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy, and works well. I have bought others online that folded out yet broke very quickly. This one's a lot more sturdy and well made. Folds out easily, and legs extend easily. The other ones I have bought had buttons you had to push in to extend the legs and it was very difficult to do. I highly recommend this item and have convinced it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Shiela spear

customer_reviews.title: There is ROOM.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this lapdesk. It seems very sturdy and I *highly* recommend the larger size as this is the first lapdesk I have had that actually has room for my mouse pad without it being under the laptop. I love the wrist cushion that works as a wrist rest and a stopper for the mouse pad and mouse, but I find the way I position my hands and arms (think split-keyboard style with elbows further out) leaves my hand/wrist on the lapdesk itself, between the rest and the edge of the lapdesk. I would love a longer rest that fits in the current position. Still highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lia Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that could turn my desk into a standing desk without costing me a lot of money and without being difficult to manage. This is perfect. It is lightweight and easy to use. Raising and lowering the height is a breeze. I wish it had a little more depth. The width is perfect for my keyboard and mouse, but books hang over the edge a bit. So far it has not been a problem, but 2 or 3 more inches would have been great. Overall, I am really pleased with this. I love that I can use this for a standing desk, a bed table, or a portable desktop podium.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my dad for Fathers Day and he LOVES it! Much easier in his neck, back and wrists, provides space for him to add needed paperwork on the side, and very easy to adjust. Highly recommend for work from home or just general computer use in a relaxed position. In Could see this being super beneficial for teen to adult age students!
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: This stand is crap do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy this thing if I was you. I had bought it and it was so crappy I had to have it returned within an hour of opening it.. it isn’t sturdy at all is small and it barely comes off the ground, avoid it at all cost.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy - highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This table is excellent for what I need. My large laptop fits easily on the surface, and the optional attachments that came with it work well in holding my mouse on the tray no matter what the angle. There is plenty of space for my legs under the tray, and the adjustable height and angle works well when I’d like to change my sitting position or angle I’m looking at the screen. I would highly recommend this item. As a matter of fact, I’ve already ordered a second one to keep out on the patio for when I work out there.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Bowerman

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars bed table - Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this (size large) bed table and use it almost every day. I need to do my study and tutoring on my 15 inches laptop (less than 4 lbs) every week, also my weekend. I have my full time job too. I prefer to stay in my bed and sofa to use my laptop. Love it as it is light weight and very stable on my soft bed, very easy adjust, flexible enough for all kind of angles for my hands, and all levels height for my shoulders. I have tried 3 difference products, this is only one I recommend. I actually order 1 more for my sister as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying This Desk
customer_reviews.text: I researched lap desks for quite some time before taking the plunge on this one. With more work from home happening, I needed something I could use in my bedroom to alleviate neck pain from my computer resting on my lap. My one real frustrating is that the legs sink into the couch cushions because they are the perfect width of the slits in the couch. I'd love if there was some sort of clip on I could use on the legs to keep this from happening. Overall though, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great, but could use rubber feet
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect size for my purposes as riser on my coffee table that can handle a keyboard and mouse. It looks good, folds up nicely, and has good height adjustment. My only gripes are the lack of rubber feet to keep it from sliding around on my table, and the amount of flex in the legs that makes it feel a little wobbly. I understand that this is primarily a bed table, so my needs as a coffee table desk are secondary, but for the price I still think rubber feet would still be a wise option.
customer_reviews.author: AHA Says

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use, tray for laptops big & small
customer_reviews.text: My son and I each got one of these tables and they are all that I had hoped and more. It helps our computers be more ergonomic when we use them on our couch. If you have a smaller computer (15") then go for the smaller one and 17" (son's), then opt for the larger one if you want to have room for a mouse. Easy fast set up and nice accessories to flexible, non-permanent options (you can plug holes, add a soft rest for your wrist, or put a hard plastic piece in that saves your computer from sliding down if you opt to slant the tray).
customer_reviews.author: Danielle, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for - A real zen desk
customer_reviews.text: Please bear in mind that I was not looking for a bed tray table; I wanted to find out a sort of "zen desk" on which I could use my MacBook Pro, Ipad, and read while sitting on my meditation cushion. I identified several options on zen online stores, but they were so expensive and rigid. This one perfectly does the job! Amazingly simple to use, foldable, positioning adjustment, and other extra features that makes it unique. On top of that, great value for money. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose E. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase this year
customer_reviews.text: I have a small apartment and have no place for a work desk and chair. This little desk solves the problem of working out of a small home. It's light weight but sturdy. It's ergo-friendly and very portable / compact at the same time. I can't think of a better design for this type of tray table. Perfect for a 13" laptop ( a bigger laptop might not work as well). The shipper box was well thought out and efficient. The tray table comes fully assembled already. This is the best thing I've purchased this year.
customer_reviews.author: S. CHOI

customer_reviews.title: Decent item, poor pre-assembly
customer_reviews.text: Item works but poor assembly. A few screw(S) showed through the table top with the legs rotating the wrong way... Fixed it myself by switching legs and hand tightening screws to not pierce through. Turned off by the table tops screw damage it came with though.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Yamson

customer_reviews.title: What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of leg room for me (I'm about 5'2 at 130 lbs) at the lowest height and I use it for my surface pro 6 with a keyboard. I adjust the height a little bit if I need it to be at eye height for long periods of sitting. I don't use the stoppers and I don't use any angle adjustment. Currently using it on bed and couch and working great for me. There is still plenty of room for a mouse pad if I needed one. It feels pretty light. Easy to fold and put away. I got the medium size.
customer_reviews.author: sally c

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: This table is pretty neat. I am using it right now while sitting in my reclining loveseat. I have a console in the middle, so if you are looking for a table to use in these sitting conditions, this fits the bill. It came with little rubber bumpers, a flat larger bumper, which will prevent your laptop from slipping, and a wrist rest of sorts which is able to prevent your mouse from slipping. It tilts, it raises and lowers. The legs pop into and out easily as well. I really like the table!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit flimsy if you rock it side to side. Very lightweight and feels a bit cheap. Otherwise it’ll hold up pretty good. It can be adjusted at a pretty decent height. My boyfriend is a bigger guy so this will fit him perfectly. There were a few scratches but nothing major enough to be a Karen about. The resting gadgets can be switched around if you’re a lefty which is awesome. The product is big enough to fit a decent size laptop and mouse pad. Although, I wish it could be bigger. Overall, good buy but could be better if it’s more sturdy and not feeling cheap for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mee Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great For Bed or for Standing Desk
customer_reviews.text: This table works great as a bed table, not sturdy in a chair or sitting on the couch because the legs are partially off the edge. Seems like good quality, but since I read people have snapped the legs off folding them I’m very careful about that. Haven’t had any trouble. Works great on a table or desk for use as a standing desk. Doesn’t work well for watching movies on an iPad or tablet while laying in bed, it doesn’t tip far enough for clear viewing.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Parah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Traveling in my RV for Large & Small Laptops
customer_reviews.text: I work in my RV and I needed a “desk” that I could use and put away with out any difficulty. This is light-weight and fits my laptops quite nicely. I have a 17” gaming laptop which is heavy that can sit on here if I don’t use a mouse, then a 15” lightweight notebook which I use with a mouse. Of course they are used separately - just want to spell that out for people who might read that wrong. It’s sturdy and doesn’t take long to adjust. Then I can fold it up and slide it next to my bed without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy wide better
customer_reviews.text: Glad I ordered the wide size, have just the right amount of leg room. Due to my couch the gap between the next cushion I have to put a towel there so it doesn’t fall down too far and prevent it from leveling out. But other than that absolutely love it!!
customer_reviews.author: kelli thompson

customer_reviews.title: Laptop Bed Tray gets 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I had a foldout pillow lap desk my sister gave me years ago which worked fine for working at home. In preparation for a business trip, I got this laptop bed tray and I don't know how I lived without it! It is the perfect size, lightweight to carry/take anywhere, has a great height adjustable feature, and the edge stoppers keep your laptop in place. This table delivered everything I hoped for and more. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Angela F

customer_reviews.title: BEST Laptop Stand for Desks, Period!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and am impressed by its high quality -- both in the materials, build, design and thoughtful features. Everything works flawlessly and EASILY -- raising, lowering, tilting and using the stoppers. On the stoppers, one is hard plastic yet not hard on the wrists, while the other is soft rubber and very ergonomic and comfortable -- so easy to pull out and put back in! This design is the best, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: overall good
customer_reviews.text: it's a sturdy and functional tray table. my biggest critique is that the laptop rest is not centered. I'm using it as I type and my left wrist keeps hitting the plastic laptop rest thingy, making my left forearm hurt. If I keep my laptop centered on the plastic, then I have to shift my upper body over to the left in order to have my laptop straight in front of me and type without hitting the plastic. It would've been perfect if this phone rest wasn't here and the laptop rest was just centered. I might be returning this...
customer_reviews.author: ashima

customer_reviews.title: Great for correct posture while sitting...
customer_reviews.text: Avantree and Nearpow make the same thing - they appear to be identical and I'm very pleased with both. My laptop is 17.5 inches so I needed the larger one. Even if you don't need the larger one, you may want it as you will have more room...my opinion only. I purchased two - one for home and one for work. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Donata Cusano

customer_reviews.title: Is it sturdy and will it tilt!
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and it is nice and folds easily and it’s also simple to adjust. It’s really not tall enough if you want to sit on the couch and work on your electronic device, which was very disappointing. The legs don’t seem sturdy and the latches that you adjust up or down and tilt are made of plastic, They seem as though they would break easily. I read the reviews on this and all of them were good, but I really don’t know if I will keep this or not.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Tray to use in bed, chair, or on counter top when
customer_reviews.text: Very flexible both in height and slope adjustments. The bumpers close to the bottom of the tray keep everything from sliding off. They are also removable and the unit comes with plugs to temporarily/permanently cover the holes where the bumpers had been. My wife and I each have one and use them to hold our tablets closer so it is easier for us to read the tablets. We also use them as food trays when watching a TV show from our chairs. We have one with a white top and one with wood grain...easy to know which belongs to whom! Lol
customer_reviews.author: dallis8491

customer_reviews.title: Helpful when bedbound
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use after a major surgery. I was going to be pretty much bed bound for 6 weeks but still needed to tend to work on my laptop. There was just enough room for my mouse & laptop that was great. I have an extremely squishy bed so it never really sat level which made it somewhat difficult to use but it was helpful nonetheless. I do not recommend using it for food or beverage of any kind as it is far too slippery.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: Good but could use a couple improvements.
customer_reviews.text: There are 2 things that would make this better: I'd like to be able to drop it a bit lower on my lap. Its still a bit too high. If I set it on top of a cooling pad, its entirely too high. I'd like a couple clips to hold the cords along the back top edge of the tray. Yes, I keep my laptop plugged in when working on it since its less likely to catch fire than when using the battery.
customer_reviews.author: HRPeck

customer_reviews.title: Glad I read the reviews, first.
customer_reviews.text: The great thing about writing reviews, are that they really help. I was about the purchase the regular size stand, but decided to first view a few comments and reviews. I realized after verifying the size I needed, I went with the larger stand (Thanks to the reviews). I can immediately tell (once I received my stand) from my setup, this was a great purchasing choice. Basically, if you are planning to use a 15.6 laptop and mouse... Go with the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisified
customer_reviews.text: Got to say this worked out perfect for using my laptop or surface pro while sitting in my recliner. Plenty of legroom and I am a husky guy. Just what I needed, no more trying to balance computers on my lap or with a larger book under them. Seems well built and sturdy as well. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We bought the medium size. My husband needed this table for his 17" laptop. It fits perfectly and leaves lots of room for his legs underneath. He uses while sitting in his recliner. We tried a different brand (Laptop Desk Alloyseed Foldable) and the legs are plastic which broke and rendered it useless. The legs on this table are metal. We are so happy with this purchase that I ordered one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life!!
customer_reviews.text: After a trip to the Physical Therapist, we concluded that working on my laptop without a tray was straining my neck. I find this tray. I thought it was a bit pricey but the reviews were excellent and it was exactly what I was looking for. Well, it is worth every penny!! Now I can use my laptop from the comfort of my couch watching TV with no more pain in my neck. The Tray features multiple level angle and adjustable height with locking legs. It is light and sturdy. It is super easy to fold and take no room to store!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bed/sofa table
customer_reviews.text: Using the bed table with my 10 inch notebook computer, mostly on the sofa, to keep the computer off of my lap. The slant feature makes using the touchpad and keyboard easy and comfortable. Also the perfect reading angle for my Kindle. I intend to carry it in my car as well when I take a car camping trip. A sturdy, well made product as it should be for the price. I bought the medium size which is perfect for my use.
customer_reviews.author: SFoz

customer_reviews.title: Serves my purpose wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I use this product in my recliner in the living room, not as a bed accessory. Not being a fan of computer trackpads, I needed a surface on which to use a mouse. The legs of my Nearpow fit perfectly between the recliner arms (your mileage may vary, of course), I've adjusted the surface slant to my taste, my MacBook Pro 16" and Logitech mouse work perfectly together on the surface...all is well in my computing world!
customer_reviews.author: J. Russell

customer_reviews.title: A bit wobbly as a stand-up desk and not high enough.
customer_reviews.text: This is fine to use if sitting or laying, but for stand-up, it doesn't really extend enough (I'm only 5' 5") and fully extended, it's a bit wobbly, so if it did extend enough, I imagine it would be even wobblier. It's fine, but I was hoping it would be good for standing, as it is, I have to put something on the table it to raise it up so I'm not bent down using it....and that kind of defeats the point.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide legs!
customer_reviews.text: Love this table! As a larger girl I really appreciate the width of the legs and the height of the table. There's plenty of room for my legs between. The tilting option is great and there are stoppers that stop your books or laptop from sliding off. There's no assembly required which was a bonus! It's also really lightweight so it's easy to carry to wherever I'm working. The only thing that could make this table better is a carrying handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TABLE!
customer_reviews.text: I got this table for myself, it's perfect for reading in bed, I have plenty of legroom and it's ideal for when I'm reading snacking when watching movies or use it for writing notes and such. I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Ilyce

customer_reviews.title: and I have an easy fix for that in mind
customer_reviews.text: I needed to get off my rear end while working and this is the cure! I knew it would not be enough space for my laptop, large mousepad, calculator, and writing area, so I bought two and they are side by side (the second one has the USB fan built in and I don't even notice it purring). It is very well made, and I have no concerns about its strength to hold my laptop (16") continually. It's simple, light weight design is not rigid, so it bounces a little while typing, but not enough to be a bother, and I have an easy fix for that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of writing and photo editing while lying in bed due to a disability. While I can type easily with the laptop on my chest this has changed everything in terms of comfort and taking the sometimes very warm computer off my chest. This will be particularly nice in the summer. Also use it while sitting in an easy chair where it spans the cushion nicely.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Siberski

customer_reviews.title: Great "desk" for working remotely!
customer_reviews.text: I work from home 2-3 day a week and I haven't set up my home office yet, so I often work from the couch (or dining room table). This is great for working on the couch. I can keep my laptop elevated, which keeps my neck from cramping from looking down all the time and helps me sit up properly and not hunch my shoulders over the keyboard. I love that I can alter the angle and height. And it folds up nicely for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Better than hunching over
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who works at the computer a lot. Needless to say, the bedroom is use as much as an office as any other room. Although I had higher expectations of this laptop desk, he says it is better than hunching over, so I have to agree with that. The main problem that he has is that when he locks it into a position, it doesn't want to stay there. we have made sure we are locking everything into place, but it just does not stay exactly when you need it. If you don't mind using your knees a bit, it works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: L. K. Spalding

customer_reviews.title: Neck saver
customer_reviews.text: My posture leaves a lot to be desired. I hunch over and pay for it with tight neck and shoulder muscles. Now I place my iPad pro on this platform and can look straight ahead, no neck bending. A physical therapist said to think of your head as a ten pound bowling ball on a stick. The mechanism for setting the height is easy, as is the tilt. I do not sit on the chaise lounge without it. Saved me from so much pain and ibuprofen. It's light. My cats sit and stare at me, perfect height.
customer_reviews.author: Zenmoments Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very thoughtful construction. Height and angle of table are adjustable. Feels very sturdy too - good build quality. One complaint: You can't set the table legs any wider, so your legs have to be close together. Just a couple more inches for wiggle room would help a lot. Oh, and I suppose if you are overweight, this would not work well for you.
customer_reviews.author: eykei

customer_reviews.title: A-Freakin-MAZING
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I am currently in school full time and I needed a desk, but I didn't want to be confined to one space. I can study on the floor without laying down, on the couch, or in my bed. I can move whenever I feel like it and I feel so free to study however I like. I love the feature that allows you to tilt the desk. I have used it to read a book on one side and take notes on the other. It is sturdy and perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi

customer_reviews.title: Glides on desk
customer_reviews.text: While the tray table itself is very sturdy and solid, the feet are hard, smooth plastic. Placed on a desk it will easily slip and glide around. While a relatively minor problem, it is quite annoying when using the tray table as a standing desk for laptop work. This could be easily prevented with rubberized feet. My cheap solution: wrap rubberbands around the feet.
customer_reviews.author: Suki

customer_reviews.title: The quality is good and the various adjustments work well for reading
customer_reviews.text: Because of medical issues my spouse spends a large amount of time in a lift recliner. This unit works perfectly for their needs. The quality is good and the various adjustments work well for reading, eating and other activities while they are in the recliner. The dimension specs allowed me to factor in the chair dimensions and it works very well for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for working in bed.
customer_reviews.text: I super like this. I use this in bed with a giant squishy pillow for my back, and I'm so comfy! I like that it tilts. I also really appreciate that you can customize it for left or right handed people. As a left handed person, I'm tired of having to adapt to things made for right handed people. I was going to organize a lefty rebellion, but since I like this desk so much, I think I'll just stay in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as well as I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I had back surgery and recovery was spent in bed for awhile. I got this to eat on and computer use. This tray is easy to assemble and is sturdy on flat surfaces. Legs can be folded to make it flat. I use it more with my computer on my coffee table. It didn't work so well on my bed but might for you. Constructed well and easy to change positions.
customer_reviews.author: Oneday....

customer_reviews.title: Partly Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: So, my perfect portable bed table would be a bit larger. There would be two plastic stops at the bottom that both prevent papers from sliding off. I found a way to use this by placing it on a bench near my computer. Space is tight in my apartment, so no regular desk to write on. For now, the portable table is OK. I honestly find it a bit expensive for what is offered. But I do appreciate the product.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Functional, compact, and easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my son's distance learning during the pandemic. This laptop tray has been essential for my son's schooling. He uses it everyday for online classes. He is able to adjust the positioning and height so that he may sit comfortably without straining his neck . Highly recommend this tray if you have more than one child doing distance learning and have limited desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Aida

customer_reviews.title: Best Option if you don't have or aren't using a desk/table for your laptop
customer_reviews.text: A nearly perfect and very functional product. Since I've stared working from home and using a laptop my already crowded computer desk and very cluttered kitchen table is not an option, so this laptop desk has been a life saver. You just have to figure out the most comfortable height and angle for yourself and then you're good to go. It's fairly easy to adjust, works great for either righties or lefties. The only things missing are a small collapsible drawer for a wireless mouse and perhaps a small cooling fan.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Wolf

customer_reviews.title: I love this table!
customer_reviews.text: This table is very versatile, it can be adjusted to any angle and height. I use this when I'm on the floor or on the bed;; I can fit this over my body and I am by no means a thin person. You can even customize it a bit where you can move the stoppers onto the right or left side to keep your mouse (whether your left-handed or right-handed) or laptop more secure. It even folds up when you're not using it!
customer_reviews.author: Trick

customer_reviews.title: Great for Teleworking
customer_reviews.text: I live in a tiny apartment and can't afford the space to have a full desk setup. This is great for teleworking--fits both my laptops if I need to use them both at the same time. Sturdy enough to set up my squishy bed with a cup of coffee that doesn't spill. Also good for eating in bed if you've become as lazy as I have during the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Need redesigning a bit
customer_reviews.text: The tray is good... although couple of issues; 1. The tray width is small for 15”+ laptops. 2. I use the tray while laying down flat on my back due to surgery. The divider that’s placed to hold the laptop mouse is very awkwardly placed. That is, placing hand over the divider to navigate the mouse causes wrist pain after a while. I consider it is design flaw. They should have flatter bracket/support there.
customer_reviews.author: razzmatazz

customer_reviews.title: Was missing a part, but I didn't need it much luckily
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's fine. I was missing one of the big stoppers for the laptop. Fortunately, I didn't need it as my laptop is stable enough at slight angles with its own rubber feet. Getting the big one fits my 13 in laptop and my iPad so that worked out well. I can probably put my dinner next to it so the larger space is nice. Got it "like new" from a previous purchase so that's what I get for saving ~$8
customer_reviews.author: L.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for couch or desk
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lapdesk, wish I bought it years ago. It helps me sit up straighter, for better neck and shoulder alignment as I use my laptop on the couch. Keeps my lap from getting scorched by the hot laptop, too. Added plus: lets the cat lay on your lap while you can still type! Nearpow is a great company, too. Really prompt response to the questions I asked.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, worried about slipping
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this product. It solves a lot of the basic problem I was trying to tackle. However, the base of legs is rather slippery on smooth surfaces. I wonder if it was supposed to come with grips on the bottom? If not, I'll have to find some of my own to add, since I want to use this as a riser for my existing table and don't want it to slide off if my cat pushes it.
customer_reviews.author: Xanthe

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and stable work surface
customer_reviews.text: No idea what some of the critical reviewers are talking about. NOT poorly made nor poorly assembled. NOT wobbly at all. In fact, I'm delighted with this purchase. I use it at my desk, for my laptop, to alternate between sitting and standing up to work. Also used it recently as a podium for an event. Very versatile and stable work surface. Wide enough for the laptop and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Betina Frisone

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Really like this, doubles as a floor stand while seated and a lap stand in a chair or on a couch. IS easy to use, sturdy and well made. Only issue is that mouse stop and laptop stop are at different heights meaning a larger laptop want to sit slightly cockeyed in the upright position.
customer_reviews.author: Sonlit Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: I received a table that had a large crack in it and customer service refused to send me a replacement. I do not recommend and will definitely not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Expensive product for poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive item for the quality you get. The legs are wobbly and not aligned correctly. I can tell the outer edge rim material is going to come up where there's a little gap where the material meets and where it connects with the board surface. The shipping was fast, it looks nice and I like that you can change the laptop ridge to be for the left or right hand. If this was $20 it would be fine but for the price it is a BAD product. I do not reccomend buying. I would return but shipping it back would cost more money than is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The everything table <3
customer_reviews.text: This table is everything: lap desk, computer desk, art table, dinner table, card table. I would have given it five stars, but one of the legs is a bit loose and clattery. Not great if you're doing soothing artwork before bed, and then CLATTER. But other than that, it's an ingenious, multipurpose design. Thank you for something so caringly-considered in a world of mindless junk.
customer_reviews.author: FamblyTime

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks fine and works as I was looking for with the exception of the mouse stopper. It loose and kept on dropping off every time I fold the table. This could easily get lost without notice. Is there way to get this thing more tight? Or I have to put super glue to have not to drop off. I am thinking to purchase another one but this loosing mouse bar held me off from repurchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: A cheap solution to a standing desk!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this. It was the least expensive option to creating a standing desk. As you can see in the photos, it is large enough to hold my keyboard and 22" monitor (my laptop is on a docking station under the desk). The legs fold, so it's easy to take off when I get tired of standing. I'm very happy with this purchase. (Note: I don't have the legs extended very far. If I did, it would be too wobbly. I don't trust it extended with my large monitor.)
customer_reviews.author: FLNewGirl

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy table!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for from a lap desk. The set up was incredibly easy and the legs make this desk durable and sturdy enough to hold up on any surface (couch, desk, etc.). When you put it on a table it doubles as a very simple standing desk which is an added bonus! Love the different adjustments you can do to height and angle as well, they work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Zulu

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: This table is a delicate table... so not exactly something you want for a table. It holds a 15" laptop and a few pens, and can support hands while typing, but it isn't the strongest by any means.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy
